{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question states that no agglutination is seen when antiserum A and antiserum B are added to a blood sample with Rh+ve factor. This suggests that the blood sample does not have any antibodies against the Rh factor, which is consistent with an O group (since O group individuals do not express the Rh factor). The fact that no agglutination occurs despite the addition of both antiserum A and antiserum B also supports this conclusion.", "answer_choice": "B"}
